name: Escale Oceania Marseille Vieux Port

reviews.text: This hotel has perfect location, and very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Excellent hotel, ideally located
reviews.text: It ıs clean and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only two negative things are they don't have room service and no porter to carry your suitcases.(specially if you have back problem like me it is too bad)
reviews.title: Too noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No fridge in rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent, all-round hotel

reviews.text: Overall good stay and will surely go back.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel excellent. We arrived late at night and the front desk clerk was amazing even at the late hour. He checked us in quickly and offered information on the area and restaurant recommendations without us even asking. He printed out maps of the area and highlighted the attractions he suggested we should not miss. The room was a nice size as was the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. We had the breakfast included in the rate and it was very good. A nice selection of breakfast items. The staff in the breakfast room was excellent they worked very hard and kept things filled. I wold not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location and staff
Great Location in Vieux Port
reviews.text: Great location right in the heart of Vieux Port. Parking nearby as well as a Metro station. Many day tours leave from here. Clean room, reasonably spacious for French standards & well appointed. Full breakfast available although we did not avail ourselves. Good value for money. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a quite convienient place to stay for a few days and visit the redone Vieux Port area in Marseille, this comes up the list for me quite a bit.
reviews.title: Great value service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel appears to be recently renovated, the rooms are clean and QUIET. It amazed me that we were right in front of tne noisy port area and when we closed the windows in the evening it was QUIET. Wonderful! Bed was comfortable and the shower area was adequate.
reviews.title: Great Location with Friendly and Helpful Staff

reviews.text: Breakfast is served on the 5th floor breakfast room. At the time of this writing, I belive breakfast was 13 Euro, which is quite reasonable for the area. While I looked inside at the breakfast buffet and it looked respectable, we preferred to take breakfast outside at the port, where many places have Petit Dejuner until 11 AM.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the location

reviews.text: At the edge of the Vieux Port, and literally beside the Metro Station, the location is unbeatable. Our room faced a side street, but it was still very noisy at night as we slept with the window ajar.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious enough, and looks quite new and clean, though a big downside was the lack of an in-room safe.
reviews.title: Only OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist, Catherine, was extremely helpful, changing our dining reservation and providing advice on how to get around.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: Spent 45 minutes driving around all the construction of Sept 2012 at the base of the old port Marseilles. Very frustrating especially since the 'map' sent with the reservations seemed to point to a location 2 blocks away. Thanks a lot, Hotel Escale Oceania. So, it wasn't cheap, it was difficult to get the key card to open the door, and the free internet access wouldn't work for 15 minutes. No breakfast included. The view is indirect; the hotel does not front on the port. The phone in the room had no directory and the 4 dedicated icon keys were ambiguous. The rooms were newly remodeled, but with pretty economical materials. Location was good right at the apex of the port. Easy walking, except for major construction, to many restaurants. Mixed emotions about staying there again.
reviews.title: Solid choice for a short stay
nice, clean, new room
reviews.text: This hotel is situated right next to the subway. Great location if you want to travel by foot around most of the tourist spots.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is around 5m walk to the Vieux Port walkway. The room was of a high standard, and immaculate. It was cleaned every day, and we had no problems with the quality of cleanliness. The staff were also very attentive, and answered our questions about the port plus surrounding areas. It made for a fantastic base for which to explore the surrounding areas. It was a little noisy at night, however with the windows closed the noise was barely noticeable. The lift was a little small, however my wife and I had no problem negotiating the stairs (there are only 6 floors in total). It is right opposite the Marseille metro system, only two stops away from the main train station. The hotel is literally opposite the Metro entrance. There are lots of restaurants in the surrounding areas.
reviews.title: Great location in Marseille

reviews.text: We stayed here in April and found it to be very comfortable and clean. The staff spoke English and were very accommodating, even letting us check in a few hours early when we arrived sooner than expected. A great option which was good value for money.
reviews.title: Great location, very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five days in Marseilles staying at this hotel while visiting our daughter who is studying there. The hotel is well situated on the front at the old port in a busy area. Although it gets busy we found there was not a lot of noise . The hotel is soundproofed, to limit the sound of traffic outside. Ideally situated across from the blue metro allows easy access throughout the city. We travelled to Castellane on the metro and then jumped on the bus which took us direcly to our daughters residence. We were impressed by the frequency of both the metro and buses and by how easy they were to use. If you intend to use these forms of transport while you are there look at the different passes you can buy eg unlimited use of all transport for three consecutive days is about ten euros! A 24hr pass is 5 euros etc.
reviews.title: Central , convenient and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving at the airport there is a bus which runs every fifteen minutes to St Charles station and from here the metro accesses the rest of the city. The cost of the bus is about 8 euros.
reviews.title: Nice and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the hotel we were greeted by friendly helpful staff who spoke English and put our poor knowledge of French to shame.The reception is on the first floor while the rooms are situated from the third floor up and can be accessed by the small lift or if you feel fit the stairs. Not sure if this is suitable for whealchair access as the corridors are narrow , however contact thehotel to check this.Our first impression of our room was the size it was on the small side.However it was a base and was very clean, warm and very comfortable.There were two tiny balconys which you could stand on but not sit out on.For those looking for a sea view I think you would have to ask to ensure this as we looked into the street and to be perfectly honest we didnt mind this.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

aka: Escale Oceania Marseille Vieux Port Hotel Marseille
description: Escale Oceania has air-conditioned rooms and is 3 minutes from St Charles train station by Metro. It is just 50 metres from Vieux Port Metro and offers free Wi-Fi access.Each of the Marseille Vieux Port’s guest rooms has soundproofing, a flat-screen TV with cable and satellite channels, a private bathroom with an Italian shower. Some have a balcony with views of the harbour.Breakfast is available and either served in the modern dining room or in the guests’ rooms. Escale Oceania is situated a short walk from a number of restaurants and bars.Escale Oceania Marseille Vieux Port is situated within walking distance of Marseille’s main historic attractions, including the Fort Saint-Jean and the Opera.
